meanings.definition: Any of a class of yellowish or brownish solid compounds found in many plants and used as astringents and in tanning.
meanings.sent1: The tannins in tea give it a slightly bitter taste.
meanings.sent2: She learned that tannins are present in the bark of trees.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the salad had so many tannins it could tan leather.
meanings.sent4: The tannins in the wood made it sturdy and durable.
meanings.sent5: The tannins in the grapes added depth to the flavor of the wine.

meanings.definition: A substance or group of compounds that are responsible for the astringent taste of red wine.
meanings.sent1: The tannins in red wine can make it taste dry.
meanings.sent2: Many people enjoy the rich flavor that tannins add to red wine.
meanings.sent3: The comedian compared the tannins in wine to the strict teacher who always made you pucker.
meanings.sent4: The tannins in the wine hugged the taste buds like a firm handshake.
meanings.sent5: The tannins in the wine left a lingering sensation on the palate.
